data.title: Wisconsin Bankers Association
data.text:
Stacy Kopecky recently joined National Exchange Bank & Trust, as a Mortgage Loan Officer for the Chilton office.

Kopecky brings with her 27 years of experience in the lending industry and has held titles of Mortgage Loan Officer and Mortgage Lending Manager for other financial institutions. In Kopecky’s new role as Mortgage Loan Officer for National Exchange Bank & Trust, she will be responsible for assisting customers with home loans and helping them along their homeownership journey, additionally she will be representing the bank and building relationships in the Chilton community and surrounding area.

Kopecky recently relocated from Plainfield, Illinois, to Appleton, where she now resides with her family. She is active in her community as a member of the school Parent Teacher Organization (PTO), Community Cares Program, and Women in Business.

Prairie Trust®, a division of Waukesha State Bank, is proud to announce the promotion of Autumn Carbonell to Trust Administrator.

“This promotion is well deserved and recognizes Autumn’s commitment to enhancing her skillset,” stated Victor J. Schultz, President of Prairie Trust. “Autumn’s expertise in assisting with complex trust administration, including Special Needs Trusts, helps distinguish our organization and has contributed to our record success.”

Autumn Carbonell joined Waukesha State Bank in 2018 as a Teller and was promoted to Assistant Teller Supervisor within a year. In 2020, she earned her Bachelor of Business Administration degree in finance from the University of Wisconsin-Whitewater and transitioned to the Prairie Trust division as a Personal Trust Assistant. After furthering her education by attending Cannon Trust School, she was promoted to Senior Personal Trust Assistant in January 2023. She further advanced her career by earning the Certified Trust and Fiduciary Advisor (CTFA) designation in February 2024. In her new role as Trust Administrator, Autumn will serve as a relationship manager and fiduciary advisor for a diverse range of trust clients.

First Business Bank is pleased to announce the promotion of Travis Froze to President of its Northeast Wisconsin Market.

“Travis’s unique blend of expertise, community involvement, and genuine interest in his clients’ success make him the perfect choice to lead our Northeast Wisconsin Market,” said Jim Hartlieb, President & CEO of First Business Bank. “His deep roots in the Fox Cities and his active involvement in local organizations reflect the core values of First Business Bank. We are confident that under Travis’s leadership, our Northeast Wisconsin Market will continue to thrive and deliver the personalized service that our clients have come to expect.”

Travis has more than 20 years of commercial banking experience in the Fox Valley area, serving primarily family owned businesses and closely held companies of all sizes. He puts clients first by listening and taking genuine interest in their business.

Born and raised in the Fox Cities, Travis takes an active approach to supporting the community. Travis currently serves on the Volunteer Fox Cities Board and on the Bay Lakes Council Boy Scouts of America Executive Board of Directors. He previously served on the YMCA of the Fox Cities Corporate Board and the Fox Cities Chamber Board, where he served as Treasurer from 2017-2019. In addition, Travis has served on the Bergstrom Mahler Museum Board and the Fox Valley Technical College Foundation Board. Travis received his bachelor’s degree in Marketing and Economics from the University of Wisconsin – Oshkosh.

Ixonia Bank is pleased to announce Steve Clark has joined the team as Senior Vice President and Director of Treasury Management.

“Steve exemplifies the high standards of client relations and tailored services that we value at Ixonia Bank. His expertise is already a significant asset to our strong team, enhancing our ability to support businesses, large and small,” states Mark Wierman, President of Ixonia Bank.

With a 38-year tenure in banking and 23 years in treasury management, he has a proven record of success. Steve is renowned for creating strategic communication with prospects and clients, focusing on best practices and solution consultation. He collaborates with commercial bankers and industry partners to provide best-in-class service while managing and exceeding clients’ expectations.

Steve strives to provide the best and most valuable insight to create security, efficiency, and optimize cash flow for his clients. Additionally, he serves as a resource for business owners looking to better protect their funds against fraud. He believes in taking the time to understand client needs and coupling them with tailored solutions. Although this level of personalization can be sporadic within the banking industry, it is standard at Ixonia Bank.

“The depth of knowledge at Ixonia Bank is impressive. The bank upholds a standard of excellence that aligns with my belief of providing valuable insights and creating security for our clients,” says Steve.

Steve obtained his Bachelor of Science in Management from Cardinal Stritch University. As a former board member of Breakthrough T1D (formerly JDRF) and a current member-at-large on the Finance Committee for Sharon Lynn Wilson Center for the Arts, Steve drives positive change in the community. Steve also enjoys spending time outdoors, long-distance cycling, kayaking, hiking, and skiing. Whether biking 50-100 miles or boating on the weekends, Steve cherishes time with his wife and two sons.

Steve is based out of the Bank’s Main Office in Ixonia, located at W1046 Marietta Avenue.

Milwaukee-based Johnson Financial Group recently announced the appointment of Evamarie Schoenborn to the role of president of Johnson Wealth, Inc.

Johnson Wealth is a subsidiary of Racine-based Johnson Financial Group. It is one of the largest investment advisory firms in Wisconsin, with approximately $10 billion in assets under management.

Schoenborn has more than 20 years of investment management experience. She was most recently chief executive officer of U.S. Bank Investments in Minneapolis. She’s also served as CEO of wealth management for Northwestern Mutual and worked at Ameriprise Financial, where she helped build the firm’s wealth management offerings.

“We are incredibly excited to welcome a proven leader like Evamarie to our senior leadership team at Johnson Financial Group,” said Jim Popp, CEO of Johnson Financial Group. “She brings deep and progressive experience in leading wealth teams and is a proven client advocate and culture-carrier.”

Johnson Wealth continues to grow its presence across the state, having completed three acquisitions in the wealth and investment advisory space over the past 10 years, while also growing organically.

“The opportunity to lead the team at Johnson Wealth is very exciting,” said Schoenborn. “JFG is a company with a history of creating deep connections in the communities they serve. That commitment to the community in presence, words and action is a competitive advantage, and I’m thrilled to have the opportunity to join the JFG team.”

Starion Bank has promoted Business Banking Officer Peter Moskal in our Middleton branch and Cash Management Officer Jaclyn Haesler in our Sun Prairie branch. Moskal has been promoted to Business Banking Officer, SVP, and Haesler to Cash Management Officer, AVP.

Moskal joined Starion Bank in 2018 as a Credit Analyst, bringing more than 10 years of experience in business banking, credit analysis and portfolio management. He became a Business Banking Officer 2020 and was previously promoted to AVP and VP.

Haesler came to Starion Bank in 2019, bringing years of experience in retail and business banking and a strong accounting and customer service foundation. She was promoted to Cash Management Officer in 2020.

“Peter and Jaclyn are invaluable to our business team at Starion Bank,” says Jeff Cook, Madison Market President. “As a community bank, we pride ourselves on training and promoting from within, and it’s a pleasure to watch these two bankers grow their careers and develop trusted relationships with our customers.”

Waukesha State Bank, a 14-branch independent community bank in Waukesha County, is pleased to announce the promotion of Becki Lee-Taylor to bank manager of its New Berlin office located at 14000 W. National Avenue.

“Becki has been an integral member of our team and has grown her knowledge and skills consistently in varying roles. We are excited to welcome her back to our New Berlin office as a familiar face and the manager of the great team we have there,” stated Heather Pfalz, Waukesha State Bank vice president – retail banking manager. “This promotion is well deserved and reflective of Becki’s strengths in cultivating relationships, delivering high quality customer service and involving herself in our communities.”

Becki Lee-Taylor earned her bachelor’s degree from the University of Wisconsin-Platteville and started her career with Waukesha State Bank in February of 2021 as a customer service representative at the New Berlin office. Over the years, Becki has taken on increasing roles and responsibilities in the retail banking department including promotions to assistant team supervisor, team supervisor and personal banker, working at both the New Berlin and Waukesha – E. Racine Avenue offices. In her new role as bank manager of the New Berlin location, Becki will be responsible for all aspects of daily branch operations, including business development, personnel management, customer service, lending, relationship management and community service.

Becki is actively involved in her community. She currently volunteers as an aquarist at the Reiman Aquarium at the Discovery World Museum in Milwaukee.
